intro: Galium transcaucasicum, commonly known as the Transcaucasian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herb with slender stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Galium transcaucasicum is native to the Caucasus region and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
